body:
<!-- Please only use this template for submitting reports about failing tests in Kubernetes CI jobs -->

/sig testing
/sig windows

/area conformance

**Which jobs are failing**:

N/A

**Which test(s) are failing**:

    [sig-storage] HostPath should support r/w [NodeConformance]
    [sig-storage] HostPath should support subPath [NodeConformance]

**Since when has it been failing**:

Before 2019-03-07. Since then, the Windows nodes' kubelet service has been passed the ``--allow-privileged=true``, which allows the test to pass.

**Testgrid link**:

https://testgrid.k8s.io/sig-windows#cfcr-vsphere-windows-master (older than 2019-03-07)

**Reason for failure**:

The tests are trying to spawn pods with a HostPath volume (``/tmp`` folder) and with ``priviledged = true`` SecurityContext. The Windows Kubelet does not support privileged containers, causing the tests to fail on Windows. The test cases' containers do not have to be privileged. The containers have to create a file on the HostPath volume, but the ``/tmp`` folder has 777 file permissions by default, meaning it should pass without privileged access.

The tests have turned green in the linked testgrid because the Windows Kubelet flag ``--allow-privileged`` has been set to true, but it shouldn't have been necessary in the first place.

**Anything else we need to know**:

title: Some HostPath tests do not require privileged Containers to pass
